 31/// Expression reduction to determine if an expression consists of
 32/// dense data at the leaves (either blocks with stride_unit_dense 
 33/// packing, subviews that are dense, or scalar_blocks).  Check is
 34/// done at runtime, checking for gaps in highest-dimension stride.
 35struct Reduce_is_expr_dense
 36{
 37  template <dimension_type            Dim0,
 38	    typename                  T>
 39  bool
 40  apply(expr::Scalar<Dim0, T> const&)
 41  {
 42    return true;
 43  }
 44
 45  template <template <typename> class O, typename B>
 46  bool
 47  apply(expr::Unary<O, B, true> const &b) { return apply(b.arg());}
 48
 49  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
 50	    typename LBlock,
 51	    typename RBlock>
 52  bool
 53  apply(expr::Binary<Operation, LBlock, RBlock, true> const& blk)
 54  {
 55    return apply(blk.arg1()) && apply(blk.arg2());
 56  }
 57
 58  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
 59	    typename Block1,
 60	    typename Block2,
 61	    typename Block3>
 62  bool
 63  apply(expr::Ternary<Operation, Block1, Block2, Block3, true> const& blk)
 64  {
 65    return apply(blk.arg1()) && apply(blk.arg2()) && apply(blk.arg3());
 66  }
 67
 68  // Leaf combine function.
 69  template <typename BlockT>
 70  bool
 71  apply(BlockT const&, Bool_type<false>) const
 72  {
 73    return false;
 74  }
 75
 76  // Leaf combine function.
 77  template <typename BlockT>
 78  bool
 79  apply(BlockT const& block, Bool_type<true>) const
 80  {
 81    typedef typename Block_layout<BlockT>::order_type order_type;
 82
 83    Ext_data<BlockT> ext(block, SYNC_IN);
 84
 85    if (Block_layout<BlockT>::dim == 1)
 86      return ext.stride(0) == 1;
 87    else if (Block_layout<BlockT>::dim == 2)
 88      return (ext.stride(order_type::impl_dim0) ==
 89	      static_cast<stride_type>(ext.size(order_type::impl_dim1)))
 90	     && ext.stride(order_type::impl_dim1) == 1;
 91    else if (Block_layout<BlockT>::dim == 3)
 92      return (ext.stride(order_type::impl_dim0) ==
 93	      static_cast<stride_type>(ext.size(order_type::impl_dim1) *
 94				       ext.size(order_type::impl_dim2)))
 95             && ext.stride(order_type::impl_dim2) == 1;
 96    else return false;
 97  }
 98
 99  // Leaf combine function.
100  template <typename BlockT>
101  bool
102  apply(BlockT const& block) const
103  {
104    return apply(block, Bool_type<Ext_data_cost<BlockT>::value == 0>());
105  }
106};
107
108/// Helper function to apply Reduce_is_expr_dense reduction.
109template <typename BlockT>
110bool
111is_expr_dense(BlockT& blk)
112{
113  Reduce_is_expr_dense obj;
114  return obj.apply(blk);
115}
116
117
118
119
120/// Reduction to check if all leaf blocks have dimension-ordering
121/// equivalent to OrderT.
122template <typename OrderT>
123struct Reduce_is_same_dim_order
124{
125public:
126  template <typename BlockT>
127  struct leaf_node
128  {
129    typedef Bool_type<Type_equal<typename Block_layout<BlockT>::order_type,
130				 OrderT>::value> type;
131  };
132
133  template <dimension_type Dim0,
134	    typename       T>
135  struct leaf_node<expr::Scalar<Dim0, T> >
136  {
137    typedef Bool_type<true> type;
138  };
139
140  template <template <typename> class Operation,
141	    typename Block>
142  struct unary_node
143  {
144    typedef Block type;
145  };
146
147  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
148	    typename LBlock,
149	    typename RBlock>
150  struct binary_node
151  {
152    typedef Bool_type<LBlock::value && RBlock::value> type;
153  };
154
155  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
156	    typename Block1,
157	    typename Block2,
158	    typename Block3>
159  struct ternary_node
160  {
161    typedef Bool_type<Block1::value && Block2::value && Block3::value> type;
162  };
163
164  template <typename Block>
165  struct transform
166  {
167    typedef typename leaf_node<Block>::type type;
168  };
169
170  template <template <typename> class O, typename B>
171  struct transform<expr::Unary<O, B, true> const>
172  {
173    typedef typename unary_node<O, typename transform<B>::type>::type
174    type;
175  };
176
177  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
178	    typename LBlock,
179	    typename RBlock>
180  struct transform<expr::Binary<Operation, LBlock, RBlock, true> const>
181  {
182    typedef typename binary_node<Operation,
183				 typename transform<LBlock>::type,
184				 typename transform<RBlock>::type>
185    ::type type;
186  };
187
188  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
189	    typename Block1,
190	    typename Block2,
191	    typename Block3>
192  struct transform<expr::Ternary<Operation, Block1, Block2, Block3, true> const>
193  {
194    typedef typename ternary_node<Operation,
195				  typename transform<Block1>::type,
196				  typename transform<Block2>::type,
197				  typename transform<Block3>::type>
198    ::type type;
199  };
200};
201
202
203template <typename OrderT,
204	  typename BlockT>
205struct Is_same_dim_order
206{
207  static bool const value =
208    Reduce_is_same_dim_order<OrderT>::template transform<BlockT>::type::value;
209};
210
211
212
213/// Reduction to determine if all leaf blocks of an expression support
214/// direct access (cost == 0).
215struct Reduce_is_expr_direct_access
216{
217public:
218  template <typename BlockT>
219  struct leaf_node
220  {
221    typedef Bool_type<Ext_data_cost<BlockT>::value == 0> type;
222  };
223
224  template <dimension_type Dim0,
225	    typename       T>
226  struct leaf_node<expr::Scalar<Dim0, T> >
227  {
228    typedef Bool_type<true> type;
229  };
230
231  template <template <typename> class Operation,
232	    typename Block>
233  struct unary_node
234  {
235    typedef Block type;
236  };
237
238  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
239	    typename LBlock,
240	    typename RBlock>
241  struct binary_node
242  {
243    typedef Bool_type<LBlock::value && RBlock::value> type;
244  };
245
246  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
247	    typename Block1,
248	    typename Block2,
249	    typename Block3>
250  struct ternary_node
251  {
252    typedef Bool_type<Block1::value && Block2::value && Block3::value> type;
253  };
254
255  template <typename Block>
256  struct transform
257  {
258    typedef typename leaf_node<Block>::type type;
259  };
260
261  template <template <typename> class O, typename B>
262  struct transform<expr::Unary<O, B, true> const>
263  {
264    typedef typename unary_node<O, typename transform<B>::type>::type
265    type;
266  };
267
268  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
269	    typename LBlock,
270	    typename RBlock>
271  struct transform<expr::Binary<Operation, LBlock, RBlock, true> const>
272  {
273    typedef typename binary_node<Operation,
274				 typename transform<LBlock>::type,
275				 typename transform<RBlock>::type>
276    ::type type;
277  };
278
279  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
280	    typename Block1,
281	    typename Block2,
282	    typename Block3>
283  struct transform<expr::Ternary<Operation, Block1, Block2, Block3, true> const>
284  {
285    typedef typename ternary_node<Operation,
286				  typename transform<Block1>::type,
287				  typename transform<Block2>::type,
288				  typename transform<Block3>::type>
289				::type type;
290  };
291};
292
293/// Report whether the expression is entirely composed of blocks that
294/// provide direct data access.
295template <typename BlockT>
296struct Is_expr_direct_access
297{
298  static bool const value =
299    Reduce_is_expr_direct_access::template transform<BlockT>::type::value;
300};
301
302} // namespace vsip::impl
303} // namespace vsip

305namespace vsip_csl
306{
307namespace dispatcher

309
310/// Evaluator to convert dense multi-dimensional expressions into
311/// 1 dimensional expressions.
312template <dimension_type D, typename LHS, typename RHS>
313struct Evaluator<op::assign<D>, be::dense_expr, void(LHS &, RHS const &)>
314{
315  static char const *name() { return "be::dense_expr";}
316
317  static bool const ct_valid =
318    D > 1 &&
319    impl::Ext_data_cost<LHS>::value == 0 &&
320    impl::Is_expr_direct_access<RHS const>::value &&
321    impl::Is_same_dim_order<typename impl::Block_layout<LHS>::order_type,
322			    RHS const>::value;
323
324  static bool rt_valid(LHS &lhs, RHS const &rhs)
325  { return impl::is_expr_dense(lhs) && impl::is_expr_dense(rhs);}
326
327  static void exec(LHS &lhs, RHS const &rhs)
328  {
329    using impl::Redim_expr;
330    typedef typename Redim_expr<1>::template transform<RHS const>::type
331      new_rhs_type;
332    typedef typename Redim_expr<1>::template transform<LHS>::type
333      new_lhs_type;
334    Redim_expr<1> redim;
335
336    // Create an lvalue that dispatch() below can write into.
337    typename impl::View_block_storage<new_lhs_type>::plain_type
338      new_lhs = redim.apply(const_cast<LHS&>(lhs));
339
340    vsip_csl::dispatch<op::assign<1>, void, new_lhs_type &, new_rhs_type const &>
341      (new_lhs, redim.apply(const_cast<RHS const&>(rhs)));
342  }
343};
344
345/// Evaluator that processes 1D dense expressions via DDA.
346template <typename LHS, 
347	  template <typename> class OP, typename A>
348struct Evaluator<op::assign<1>, be::dense_expr,
349  void(LHS &, expr::Unary<OP, A, true> const &)>
350{
351  typedef expr::Unary<OP, A, true> RHS;
352  typedef OP<typename A::value_type> op_type;
353
354  static char const *name() { return "be::dense_expr";}
355
356  static bool const ct_valid = (!impl::Is_expr_block<LHS>::value &&
357				impl::Ext_data_cost<LHS>::value == 0 &&
358				!impl::Is_expr_block<A>::value &&
359				impl::Ext_data_cost<A>::value == 0);
360
361  static bool rt_valid(LHS &, RHS const &) { return true;}
362
363  // Even though LL and AA can be fully infered from LHS and A,
364  // we may not refer to those types here as LHS and A may not be valid
365  // at all (and ct_valid above evaluate to 'false').
366  template <typename LL, typename AA>
367  static void 
368  apply(op_type const &op,
369	LL lhs, stride_type lhs_stride,
370	AA a, stride_type a_stride,
371	length_type size)
372  {
373    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<LHS>::storage_type lhs_st;
374    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<A>::storage_type a_st;
375    for (index_type i = 0; i != size; ++i)
376      lhs_st::put(lhs, i * lhs_stride, op(a_st::get(a, i * a_stride)));
377  }
378  static void exec(LHS &lhs, RHS const &rhs)
379  {
380    // Even though this is a 1D assignment, the blocks needn't be 1D !
381    // To complicate things further, LHS and RHS may have different dimensionality
382    // (e.g., Dense<2> and Redim<...>)
383    dimension_type const lhs_minor = LHS::dim - 1;
384    dimension_type const a_minor = A::dim - 1;
385    impl::Ext_data<LHS> ext_lhs(lhs);
386    impl::Ext_data<A> ext_a(rhs.arg());
387    apply(rhs.operation(),
388	  ext_lhs.data(), ext_lhs.stride(lhs_minor),
389	  ext_a.data(), ext_a.stride(a_minor),
390	  ext_lhs.size());
391  }
392};
393
394/// Evaluator that processes 1D dense expressions via DDA.
395template <typename LHS, 
396	  template <typename, typename> class OP, typename A1, typename A2>
397struct Evaluator<op::assign<1>, be::dense_expr,
398  void(LHS &, expr::Binary<OP, A1, A2, true> const &)>
399{
400  typedef expr::Binary<OP, A1, A2, true> RHS;
401  typedef OP<typename A1::value_type, typename A2::value_type> op_type;
402
403  static char const *name() { return "be::dense_expr";}
404
405  static bool const ct_valid = (!impl::Is_expr_block<LHS>::value &&
406				impl::Ext_data_cost<LHS>::value == 0 &&
407				!impl::Is_expr_block<A1>::value &&
408				impl::Ext_data_cost<A1>::value == 0 &&
409				!impl::Is_expr_block<A2>::value &&
410				impl::Ext_data_cost<A2>::value == 0);
411
412  static bool rt_valid(LHS &, RHS const &) { return true;}
413
414  // Even though LL et al. can be fully infered from LHS etc.,
415  // we may not refer to those types here as they may not be valid
416  // at all (and ct_valid above evaluate to 'false').
417  template <typename LL, typename AA1, typename AA2>
418  static void 
419  apply(op_type const &op,
420	LL lhs, stride_type lhs_stride,
421	AA1 a1, stride_type a1_stride,
422	AA2 a2, stride_type a2_stride,
423	length_type size)
424  {
425    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<LHS>::storage_type lhs_st;
426    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<A1>::storage_type a1_st;
427    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<A2>::storage_type a2_st;
428    for (index_type i = 0; i != size; ++i)
429      lhs_st::put(lhs, i * lhs_stride,
430		  op(a1_st::get(a1, i * a1_stride),
431		     a2_st::get(a2, i * a2_stride)));
432  }
433  static void exec(LHS &lhs, RHS const &rhs)
434  {
435    // Even though this is a 1D assignment, the blocks needn't be 1D !
436    // To complicate things further, LHS and RHS may have different dimensionality
437    // (e.g., Dense<2> and Redim<...>)
438    dimension_type const lhs_minor = LHS::dim - 1;
439    dimension_type const a1_minor = A1::dim - 1;
440    dimension_type const a2_minor = A2::dim - 1;
441    impl::Ext_data<LHS> ext_lhs(lhs);
442    impl::Ext_data<A1> ext_a1(rhs.arg1());
443    impl::Ext_data<A2> ext_a2(rhs.arg2());
444    apply(rhs.operation(),
445	  ext_lhs.data(), ext_lhs.stride(lhs_minor),
446	  ext_a1.data(), ext_a1.stride(a1_minor),
447	  ext_a2.data(), ext_a2.stride(a2_minor),
448	  ext_lhs.size());
449  }
450};
451
452/// Evaluator that processes 1D dense expressions via DDA.
453template <typename LHS, 
454	  template <typename, typename, typename> class OP,
455	  typename A1, typename A2, typename A3>
456struct Evaluator<op::assign<1>, be::dense_expr,
457  void(LHS &, expr::Ternary<OP, A1, A2, A3, true> const &)>
458{
459  typedef expr::Ternary<OP, A1, A2, A3, true> RHS;
460  typedef OP<typename A1::value_type,
461	     typename A2::value_type,
462	     typename A3::value_type> op_type;
463
464  static char const *name() { return "be::dense_expr";}
465
466  static bool const ct_valid = (!impl::Is_expr_block<LHS>::value &&
467				impl::Ext_data_cost<LHS>::value == 0 &&
468				!impl::Is_expr_block<A1>::value &&
469				impl::Ext_data_cost<A1>::value == 0 &&
470				!impl::Is_expr_block<A2>::value &&
471				impl::Ext_data_cost<A2>::value == 0 &&
472				!impl::Is_expr_block<A3>::value &&
473				impl::Ext_data_cost<A3>::value == 0);
474
475  static bool rt_valid(LHS &, RHS const &) { return true;}
476
477  // Even though LL et al. can be fully infered from LHS etc.,
478  // we may not refer to those types here as they may not be valid
479  // at all (and ct_valid above evaluate to 'false').
480  template <typename LL, typename AA1, typename AA2, typename AA3>
481  static void 
482  apply(op_type const &op,
483	LL lhs, stride_type lhs_stride,
484	AA1 a1, stride_type a1_stride,
485	AA2 a2, stride_type a2_stride,
486	AA3 a3, stride_type a3_stride,
487	length_type size)
488  {
489    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<LHS>::storage_type lhs_st;
490    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<A1>::storage_type a1_st;
491    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<A2>::storage_type a2_st;
492    typedef typename impl::Ext_data<A3>::storage_type a3_st;
493    for (index_type i = 0; i != size; ++i)
494      lhs_st::put(lhs, i * lhs_stride,
495		  op(a1_st::get(a1, i * a1_stride),
496		     a2_st::get(a2, i * a2_stride),
497		     a3_st::get(a3, i * a3_stride)));
498  }
499  static void exec(LHS &lhs, RHS const &rhs)
500  {
501    // Even though this is a 1D assignment, the blocks needn't be 1D !
502    // To complicate things further, LHS and RHS may have different dimensionality
503    // (e.g., Dense<2> and Redim<...>)
504    dimension_type const lhs_minor = LHS::dim - 1;
505    dimension_type const a1_minor = A1::dim - 1;
506    dimension_type const a2_minor = A2::dim - 1;
507    dimension_type const a3_minor = A3::dim - 1;
508    impl::Ext_data<LHS> ext_lhs(lhs);
509    impl::Ext_data<A1> ext_a1(rhs.arg1());
510    impl::Ext_data<A2> ext_a2(rhs.arg2());
511    impl::Ext_data<A3> ext_a3(rhs.arg3());
512    apply(rhs.operation(),
513	  ext_lhs.data(), ext_lhs.stride(lhs_minor),
514	  ext_a1.data(), ext_a1.stride(a1_minor),
515	  ext_a2.data(), ext_a2.stride(a2_minor),
516	  ext_a3.data(), ext_a3.stride(a3_minor),
517	  ext_lhs.size());
518  }
519};
